website_summaries.verdict: The go-to choice for dedicated music lovers, the Echo Plus is the perfect pairing of a top-tier speaker for filling the room with crisp sound and the universal handiness of Alexa voice controls.
pros: Perfect for streaming music and taking calls
cons: its premium audio drives up the price

website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for an Alexa-enabled speaker with a Zigbee hub, the Amazon Echo Plus is your best bet. If you're looking for the best sound quality, the Sonos One is still the top contender.
pros: The second-gen Echo Plus looks better than before and includes a temperature sensor and upgraded speakers
cons: It's Amazon's most expensive smart speaker and there are better-sounding options out there for the true audiophile

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time purchasing an Echo Alexa of my own. I’ve used an Alexa 2nd Gen at my job and it’s pretty nice. I noticed the difference between the 2nd and 3rd Gen is that the 3rd Gen speaker is way louder and clear and I like that. I’m still playing with it and getting used to it but I do LOVE the Twilight Blue. That’s a sexy color to be honest lol. So far, I’m impressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchele

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been waiting for the next generation for some time. I got one of these for when I’m in my hot tub and is perfect to sit on the patio and have great sound. Easy setup, great response time, the sound is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Generation is another winner
customer_reviews.text: Always a fan of the echo family and the sound on this one is wonderful. Great for a room and connected via Bluetooth for computer speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Nate L.

customer_reviews.title: What a disaster
customer_reviews.text: Yikes. Alexa constantly says she's unable to do that task at the moment when I'm telling it to set an alarm or play music etc. Its mic really needs help as well as I often have to yell at it while only 10 feet away in a low noise area. Good luck finding information out, it cant find Jack. The speaker is average and would be acceptable if the other features worked close to flawlessly. Here's the thing. Its had how many years to make this product better? It seems just like gen one echo.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rohrer

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Bose Blue that the battery died in.
customer_reviews.text: This Echo sounds incredible! I play all my units together, this one and two regular size Echo dots and they all seem to pick up the sound from this one. The regular Echo dots sound kind of tinny to me. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie (Melzie)

customer_reviews.title: Worst speaker ever?
customer_reviews.text: None of the apps sync with the speaker, even if you have the subscription to the music service it just takes you to the settings and says you need an active subscription. There are 100+ negative reviews everyday in the Alexa app about people experiencing the same thing. IF YOU HAVE AN IPHONE THERE IS A GOOD CHANCE THE APP WILL NOT WORK PROPERLY!
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade from my echo 2nd gen. I use it in my bathroom so I can listen to music. It took me by surprise when it made the shower floor rattle a bit. Overall great product. UPDATE Apparently the new echo didnt like sharing the pedestal with my ceramic bird like my old echo did. Why do I say this? It shook it right off! Overall still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Value for money amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I’m amazed with the speaker quality, improved bass and more louder. Loved it
customer_reviews.author: Rohit Walia

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Echo Does It Again!
customer_reviews.text: I suppose most people are wondering the obvious? Does it have any new features? Does it go well with your decor? Can you order a pizza and in fact, have Alexa pay for it? OK, that one I haven't tried yet... but I will tell you that it is an upgrade, looks sleeker than older versions, and the sound packs a punch! Some services like apple music are atrocious! The service doesn't stay connected, and it's hardly useable. I venture to guess that this issue is fixable but this far is a letdown. If you're looking for a smart assistant that is extremely useful and always works... look no further! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: DONALD H. CLAFLIN

customer_reviews.title: No blue tooth.
customer_reviews.text: Why does my gen2 Alexa have blue tooth, but this new gen3 doesn’t? If blue tooth doesn’t work, it’s likely I’m sending it back and not buying anymore echo products. I don’t read anywhere that clearly says we took blue tooth away. It says it’s the same thing just a few enhancements to speakers and such.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Interesting
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and sounds better then the others.However, the light ring started turning green and and would a a pulsating thing. when I looked up what the color meant I read that either I was getting an incoming call or something was eavesdropping on me. immediately put it into "do not disturb" and after that I never saw the light again. I have multiple Alexa devices and have never had this happen.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Rocks!!!

customer_reviews.title: Horribly, horribly glitchy.
customer_reviews.text: Saying the device I received was buggy is an understatement. Within a few minutes, it stopped being able to respond to requests. “Sorry, something went wrong.” What went wrong? No indication from the device or in the app. “Sorry I didn’t get that.” I’m two feet in front of it, and it can’t understand yes, no, or stop. Had to unplug it to stop music playback. It seems like after a minute or two of use, it just falls apart. Meanwhile my other Echo Dots have been without any issues since day one. Looking at other comments, I’m guessing I got a dud - really disappointing considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael MacGregor

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality, Bad Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality sounds so cheap and overly bassy. There is a much longer delay when requesting Alexa perform any actions. I also have to repeat requests sometime several times for any action to take place. Several times I'll request something and Alexa repeats a completely random request instead. I regret opting-in on the trade-in offer as I prefer my "old" Gen 2 devices, which were accepted at a greatly reduced amount. The tech support offered me nothing as they don't seem to know about their own products. It is not giftable as I don't believe it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: George Stoll

customer_reviews.text: edit- There’s no point in writing a negative review on an Amazon product because they won’t post it. Just post the good ones. I have my speakers paired and run them in stereo. The set up was easy. To me, the sound quality is OK ( I’m no sound expert). But sometimes one speaker will stop playing in the middle of a song and start a new song while the other speaker continues playing the original song. This happens often. Then I have to tell Alexa to stop, then start again. This is annoying. I’m hoping because the 3rd generation is new, this is a bug that will soon be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Lazy Lowbowski

customer_reviews.title: Great companion for an elderly person ... the sound is GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Great so far (2 weeks). I bought it for my elderly aunt (94 years old) and she loves it since she just talks to it and it turns on the radio and she has someone to talk to in the morning. The only problem is she keeps calling her "Alexis" instead of "Alexa" ... lol. But she is finally getting the name right. Overall, it works great. She keeps the volume up rather high which is why I bought the Echo instead of the smaller one and the sound is great. We'll see who lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Miami

customer_reviews.title: Better than Sonos for way less money? In many cases yes!
customer_reviews.text: I like this better than my Sonos system with Alexa. You can pair Echos to play throughout your home, and it's easier than trying to setup my Sonos to do the same. You can control the Echo via voice, Alexa app, or through the Amazon Music app. All of these are leaps better than the buggy Sonos app. The sound quality is fantastic and the value for your money is higher than any competitor. I do believe I will be purchasing Amazon Echos from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: The new echo is very responsive. Will be buying addons
customer_reviews.text: Just set up the new Echo 3rd generation and alexa is very responsive, great sound quality, and you can easily connect other premium services. Just trying to figure out how to connect Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Roberts

customer_reviews.title: It's not amazing but not bad.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Alexa product. I was mainly looking for a smart speaker that integrated with Spotify to put in the kitchen and that didn't break the bank. The audio sounds a little muffled and adjusting the eq helps a little bit. I always feel like i'm struggling to get the volume of Alexa's voice and the music just right. In the morning she is too loud and at night when we are working in the kitchen she is too quiet. I think once the homepod integrates with spotify I will probably go that route instead.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: Alexa hits another home run
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in a bundle and was happy when it finally all came in. Yes, it did not come all together. It paired without problems and updated itself in about 10 minutes. The sound is rich and room filling with very little distortion. Alexia responds and adjusts in a few seconds. The sound is even better than the first which was good considering its limitations. This is the wilder, louder and better sister. LOL, I use it every day and have to say it is Awesome. If you have trouble pairing, delete the set and then recreate the set. it works, A+ If this was helpful please indicate, I purchased this and use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cart

customer_reviews.title: New Echo Plus is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love our new 2nd generation Echo Plus! With the built-in hub, I've already connected almost everything I can to our Echo Plus and our original Echo Dot. Verbal home automation at it's finest! Music sounds great when played through our new Echo! You can't go wrong with the new Echo Plus.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Useless even for $59
customer_reviews.text: Took the plunge seeing as it was only $59. The Alexa app freezes during set up. Couldn’t get the aux to “in”. It’s now bricked, stuck with a constant blue circle and can’t reset it. Amazon gets confused when I have accounts in Japan and the UK in addition to the US and kindly talks Japanese.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective Device
customer_reviews.text: This device did not work. Can not connect to wifi, which makes it an expensive paper weight. We own at 6 other similar devices. Will be returning and purchasing again, but from Best Buy where I'll not only get a functioning device, but I can collect points. The price is also the same.
customer_reviews.author: O.

customer_reviews.title: bad quality
customer_reviews.text: 1-try to ask ALEXA play RTHK1 from Tunein ( you can try ) see what you get 2-if you connect echo plus via Audio or Bluetooth from you smartphone it will not Pair with Amerzon SubWoofer? what a waste ! 3-it start talking by itself one to two time a day particularly during MidNight ! 4-when you play music and pair Echo plus to Echo Sub woofer when you commad" ALEXA stop" echo plus stop but echo sub woofer keep playing with very low bass sound ??? how is this possible for such "BIG" Amazon company roll out products like this????
customer_reviews.author: william wong

customer_reviews.title: AMAZON is spying on you with this device- a repulsive invasion of privacy...
customer_reviews.text: According to recent Bloomberg reports, Amazon has employees listening to your private life... this is a sleazy, creepy and disgusting practice and I am sorry we purchased one- which has since been unplugged and won't be used again...
customer_reviews.author: Cary Opteris

customer_reviews.title: Great new Amazon Alexa Echo
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this Echo sounds great and the voice is so natural. I bought a Dot at the same time for upstairs and it works great as well. I plan on ordering 2 more Dot’s and I’m looking at buying a couple thermostats to take advantage of the built in hub for smart devices.
customer_reviews.author: BillyOh

customer_reviews.title: What duds.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 and subwoofer they sound like they shorted out . They would play maybe one song with all three playing next song they would go out one then the other. Has Amazon tech help twice. They did it play continuously .They werepacked with a small amount of of plastic that was blowed up like small plastic bags. I think they should have used styrofoam to protect the speakers , they were probably throughed around doing shipping and caused something to come a loose. The only thing I noticed is they would no play continuously. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: The Music Diva

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Blue Color, Meh Everything Else
customer_reviews.text: As an early adopter for Echo v1, I thought now would be a good time to see what kind of improvements Amazon has made to their Alexa platform. I also have Dots in each of my kids room, a fire stick, and a fire 8 tablet. I don't feel this new generation has done anything to make it a better product, other than a great blue color. I feel my first gen sounded better than this one. I actually just moved it to a spare family room downstairs and hooked up my Google Mini again. Meh.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Save it for gen 4!
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's the best in its class persay. But It always seems to go offline and wont play or listen to what i ask. I had way less trouble with second gen... it has a harder time staying in everywhere music mode.. so I would say save your money and advise echo.. to fix the basics before ya out more bells and whistles in something that ain't already working well!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love our new Alexa
customer_reviews.text: We had a 1st generation Echo for several years and used Amazon's trade-in program to get a discount off of a new Echo. The process was easy and straightforward and we're very happy with our new device. Is there a huge difference between old and new? No, not really. You change the volume with + and - buttons instead of twisting the dial. I do like the new color options available. We got the Heather Gray color and it blends in nicely with our living room furniture. The deal included a Phillips hue bulb, so that was a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: DaDaDa20

customer_reviews.title: One make work fine but when you make them a sterio pair they don't
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the two Echo Plus's and the Sub and come to find out BOTH Echo's respond to your voice so you have to train both to do the same command OR they don't complete the task you asked for because they are confused. Let not mention the Sub doesn't work with the Prime Music Single Device plan so the music playback didn't work. Will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Always ready when you are
customer_reviews.text: This echo is really incredible! I can ask it to turn off my lights, play the music channels I frequent on Pandora, call my friends or family or what the weather is forecast for the next morning so I can plan accordingly for what to wear & if I need to let my vehicle warm the frost off of the windshield. Also, the sound that comes out of this unit is phenomenal! For its compact size it really packs a punch even on the bass line. Can't say enough good things about it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C

customer_reviews.title: After 5 months...just horrible
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for the first 4 months then would just stop working 3-4 times per day. No longer understands us consistently and constantly loses connection while none of our other "smart" devices do this. Our echo dots have worked flawlessly for well over a year but this "premium" echo is now an ugly paperweight because it is out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper McFearson

customer_reviews.title: Is this Normal?
customer_reviews.text: I feel like she doesn’t hear me sometimes. I have to say “Alexa” 2 or 3 times. Also, is the light at the tip supposed to continually keep spinning?
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: As a pair, much better sound, but they cant hear as well.
customer_reviews.text: Got a pair of these to go with the new sub. The speakers sound good and have a nice full range especially with the sub. The speakers themselves dont hear the commands as well as the standard echo I have been using. The other thing that is a little annoying, the voice responce is very low volume compared to the music. It seems like I am adjusting the volume a lot more often. The last item is that when speaking to, the stereo pair both try to listen, only one responds but as I said in the beginning they dont respond as well.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey r olson

customer_reviews.title: Downgrade . Bring back first gen!
customer_reviews.text: I had the first gen and I used it in my music room to be able to Bluetooth songs from time to time but then it broke so I replaced it with this and the sound on this is sooo low even at full volume that my iPhone speakers is louder.
customer_reviews.author: Chris N

customer_reviews.title: Gen 3 improvement incremental
customer_reviews.text: This speaker, after the Gen 2 echo, didn't blow my socks off. It sounds great, but then my gen 2 sounded very good also. I also have a pair of gen 2's grouped as a stereo pair, grouped also with an Echo Sub. I wouldn't even consider replacing those Gen 2's with Gen 3's. With the Sub doing a bunch of the system's work, the system sounds great to me already. So if you're buying new, get the Gen 3 for sure (not a used or refurbed set of Gen 2s) If you have Gen 2s, you probably should keep them. Unless you are a toy boy like me!
customer_reviews.author: Circuit Breaker

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use the Stereo mode feature however this is extremely limited. It only works with streaming so if you want to play something through Bluetooth it only plays through one speaker. The speakers audio quality is crappy considering I thought the plus edition would have good quality. Also I bought these to use as stereo sound for my fire tv but it turns out that it is not compatible and even though my tv has Bluetooth as an option it still only plays through one speaker so it doesn’t make since to use it. Very disappointed with this product and wish I never bought it. Would not suggest buying this or any other Alexas
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Addict

customer_reviews.title: Problems with 3rd Generation
customer_reviews.text: I was doing a trade-in with my first generation Echo. Though the sound in the third generation was excellent, I had several problems that started a few days after I had it. Echo would stop playing music and books for a time, then just start back up. It double beeped periodically. It was not my Wi-Fi because my Dot had no problems at all. Music and books skipped and was garbled now and then. I reset the new one and did everything to rectify the situation. I then decided to keep my first generation and return the third generation. The third generation was introduced in September 2019. Too soon? Maybe or perhaps it was my particular device.
customer_reviews.author: Karenique

customer_reviews.title: Good base and highs.
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound of the 3rd Generation echo. The base if very good and the high are also very good. It does seme to be a little slow at responding to its name compared to other echo devices like the 3rd generation dot. By feel, you can't tell the differences between the echo 3rd generation and the 2nd generation plus. This is coming from a totally blind person. I wish that the 3rd generation echo had a build in temp sensor so I could get the temp of the room like the 2nd generation Echo plus does. There isn't any reason it couldn't have this. My own thoughts! All the echos should have that ability.
customer_reviews.author: Dr-Phone

customer_reviews.title: Alexa gets a little dumber every day
customer_reviews.text: I was a pre-order for the first gen Echo. I now own maybe 6 Echo devices. I would have hoped that Alexa would be smarter by now. Sure, new functions have been added, but answers to questions are mostly awful, Alexa tells me my Wemo smart switch isn't responding though OK Google can instantly turn it on and off seconds after I get that report from Alexa. Misunderstands much of what I say, and that hasn't improved one bit over time. I now use it to play music occasionally and to add things to my grocery list. Not much else. I had hoped for more...
customer_reviews.author: smoddelm

customer_reviews.title: With the *Home Theater update* in the alexa app, creating a 'home theater group' was a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely enjoy this purchase!! Bought to pair with my echo plus and firetv 4k. With the *Home Theater update* in the alexa app, creating a 'home theater group' was a breeze. Nice sound quality, no audio delay/sync issues, well constructed... It just works great upon set up. The only con is not with the echo itself, but with volume controls within the alexa app. It would be very beneficial if users were able to control Left/Right channel volume controls independently from one another rather than solely as a pair. (As applies to Home Theater mode only). **NOTE: while in bluetooth mode or in 'stereo set' left/right volume can be controlled independently* Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't pair with wifi
customer_reviews.text: I spent an entire day, literally, with 2 online Amazon assistants and one high tech phone assistant. No one was able to figure out why the Echo would not connect with my wifi. This was a disaster right from the start, when in the first "shipment of the Echo", water bottles were sent in the package by mistake. Amazon replaced that shipment, and then the Echo wouldn't work. Getting a return label took several attempts and finally requests for a "manager", who had to make several tries to email a return label. One of the worst experiences ever, as an Amazon Prime member.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Englander

customer_reviews.title: very nice with a couple small issues
customer_reviews.text: to no surprise, the sleep timer doesn't work on this like the 2nd gen echo. I've been back and forth trying to get it fixed but it's something the devs have to fix and it's clear it'll take some time. however, the speaker quality is amazing on this. I watched a few shows and it sounded like I was in a movie theater. there is a super slight delay though (I'm using the line in feature, something new I believe - super useful, should have always been a feature). one last thing I find useful is the room temperature feature. I dunno if this was in the first echo plus, but it's nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: What set up?
customer_reviews.text: My intention is not to pile on the five-star rating for this product, but it can't be helped. It really is a superb offering from Amazon. Voice-recognition is top notch. Sound quality is excellent. As for the "ease of setting it up", all I can say is; What set up? - I mean, just plug it in folks and you're all set. The amazon app will take care of the rest. (Dare I say; Plug and play"?) Anyway, my comments may be identical to most reviewers' but it's really that good. Highly recommended! Thanks to Amazon's technical team for coming up with this device! - By the way, I'm thinking of getting another one this Christmas...
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jaug

customer_reviews.title: "I'm sorry I'm having trouble understanding right now."
customer_reviews.text: We have a 1st gen echo and several dots. I bought this echo for the improved sound, but very much regret doing so. This particular model only responds about 50% of the time. The light turns on, flashes, and then turns off without responding. Or it flashes for awhile and then says "I'm sorry I'm having trouble understanding right now." It also stutters when responding such that it only clearly says every 3rd or 4th word - the weather is "Today blur blur 8 degrees blur blur and partly blur." Our other echoes on the same network and in the same location are much better.
customer_reviews.author: JupiterJewel

customer_reviews.title: Diappointing
customer_reviews.text: ALEXA was synched to our home systems (Sonos) and Amazon Prime Music accounts however there are many connectivity issues. Alexa is really not able to provide the music we want to hear on the first command. You have to narrow down your searches considerably. Very frustrating. The connection on Sonos is also cumbersome. I would not recommend Alexa in conjunction with Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Candid Viewer

customer_reviews.title: CUSTOMER SERVICE AGENT - WORST
customer_reviews.text: I spoke with someone via chat about the 4 echo's I purchased and they are rude, not helpful and very impolite!!!!! Ashish | Customer Service Maragadham | Customer Service What happened Amazon??? you always have nice polite and very helpful agents, but today I had the worst experience. I am shocked!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marj

customer_reviews.title: Veryy Happy!
customer_reviews.text: i am an old guy, I don't hear some highs or some lows very well. I have four echo dots. Music from all sides was/is great. Then I bought this echo. If I play it at it's loudest, it blows me away! It was hard to detect the dots though. But I turned down to about 75% and my living room sounds like a live concert no matter what genre I play (I love most music from classical, opera, old rock, old rock & roll, blues old and new all the way up to today's heavy metal!) Thanks so much Amazon! Amazing sound set up without using a months wages!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Thornburg

customer_reviews.title: Another amazon win
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my seventh or eighth Alexa device, and I’ve had the original Echo for sometime. I found the improvements they made these products exceptional along the way, and I have several dots and other at Alexa devices around the home. This one has an exceptional sound, and works really well in the bedroom I placed it. I had a doubt in that location previously that really didn’t have the sound quality or depth I was looking for in that application. This thing is a great value on the sale that they have going, and saving $30 on something that used to be $100 is an exceptional buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product the power on this speaker is unbelievable! It works well with my Amazon music and I’m sure it will work well with all the other apps that it offers. I specially love the special functions where you can put in a sentence and ask Alexa a specific response LOL it’s quite enjoyable. She’ll do just about anything you want her to all the way down to being your alarm clock. I was thoroughly impressed I was in my living room and could talk to her in my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Miss C~

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: Dissapointed that this device keeps freezing and becoming unresponsive most often when playing music. Amazon tech support recommendations were to reset the device which doesn't work. It fixes the problem in the moment but doesn't fix whatever the underlying issue is. I have not had this problem with any of my other amazon devices. If regularly unplugging and restarting your device isn't a problem for you then it's a great product. It's materials are good quality, sounds fantastic, looks great but I can not overlook its faults... especially if I can't trust it to play music while putting my toddler down for a nap.
customer_reviews.author: Wyrmie

customer_reviews.title: Cool party gift but needy as a teenager in a mall (dated example but whatever)
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and pair “made for Alexa” products. If you have other devices that use smart things, that’s another app that controls what Alexa already controls. It is likely I am dumb, however, I had no idea I needed a physical hub to control things like door locks and other smart devices. Every device wants an app, all apps claim to be a single point of control. Feels like the windows 3.11 days where you had to install a hundred drivers that may or may not work and fight with each other. After a few weeks I finally accepted it and bought the Samsung smart hub g2. Have not set it up yet.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Snowden

customer_reviews.title: Is it really smart?
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this thing gets such good ratings. I have about 15 devices all on the same network and work group. It can only find the thermostat. Can't find any of the samsung/lg tvs all of which are smart. It can't even find my Samsung Smart Series 8 1.5year old tv. I have tried enabling stuff through the Alexa app, but its honestly a waste of money IMHO. We had google home too, and it was only slightly better. Got this becuase I just figured Google Home wasnt up to par, and Alexa is advertised as controlling all these smart things. In short, don't buy any of them, save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Laura H

customer_reviews.title: Best echo feature set
customer_reviews.text: Of all the echo products I have, I think this is generally my favorite. The design is very sleek, the speaker is loud and clear, and being able to use it as a Zigbee hub is awesome. Generally, the Zigbee hub in this device is more reliable/capable than the dedicated hubs for individual products. The Alexa app handles all the different smart home protocols well (Bluetooth, Zigbee, WiFi) so I can easily control all my devices transparently with the app/voice, without having to worry about the protocol.
customer_reviews.author: Jake W.

customer_reviews.title: what's not to like
customer_reviews.text: A nice device, worth its price especially when on sale. Use for playing music is oddly limited to a relatively modest list of the millions of songs available to subscribers of Amazon Prime Music. Not sure why, but often it simply cannot locate pieces that are easily available when using Amazon Music on a cell phone or computer. In sum, Echo needs better interface with Amazon Music so that one can retrieve whatever is available to subscribers. That's why we pay for Amazon Music!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: No ideal for Spanish or outside US
customer_reviews.text: I, as an Amazon client, who lives outside the United States and paid Prime subscription for years, I must say that I made a mistake by choosing "Alexa". Still very immature in Latin Spanish and to be honest I feel like a second-rate client, because everything is made for clients in the United States. In summary; If your system goes to outside the United States or you need it in Latin Spanish, your choice is with "OK Google"
customer_reviews.author: Camilo Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with my new Echo Plus. I have so far primarily used it to listen to music. The quality is much improved over the Echo Dot. I have been happy to discover that I can now access specific classical music performers. I had had problems with that in the past, although that was more of an Alexa issue than an Echo issue. She seems to be able to provide greater access to a wider range of classical music now. I haven't tried integrating it with other functions.
customer_reviews.author: JDE

customer_reviews.title: Gen 1 is still better. Better luck next time.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is a bit muffled, but the bass and volume are good. Fairly close to the Gen 1 echo (unlike Gen 2, which is horrible). I did a side by side comparison like I did with the Gen 2. Gen 1 had a clear victory in clarity and a slim victory with bass and volume. On a separate note, I'm having some trouble with the Gen 3 staying engaged when I request something. The blue light turns off before I can finish the second word after Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Punisher71

customer_reviews.title: F$ Amazon and F&%$ Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your F&$#ing money on these pieces of $hi$. They never respond and the software is a comical sideshow. Amazon claims they are the future and they are not. They can't pickup your voice an inch away or a mile away. Stop being lazy and take back control of your home. Because when you need them to work they won't. They get progressively worse and are a complete waste of money. Don't do it!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: 3rd gen is garbage that's constantly misunderstanding a beta alexa user!
customer_reviews.text: These 3rd gen Alexa's are complete garbage. It's constantly misunderstanding and performing actions that I did not request. My favorite is when Laundry Light on = Now playing Rihanna.. I have never asked my alexa to play music from her but it keeps happening over and over. I never had these problems prior to 3rd gen alexa's and I have had an alexa since beta testing! I never have the problems with the dots I have in my house or the beta version Alexa or any version other than these.
customer_reviews.author: owsley6

customer_reviews.title: Low volume
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Alexa because I thought I blew it anapeaker in my old alexa. For some reason the volume is down on alexa. I ordered this one and the volume is not loud at all. I called amazon and they say they have no bad reviews on the volume. When I got my original alexa you could hear it upstairs. This alexa you can not hear at all upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy, but...
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Echo Plus for about a year now, and am happy with it overall. The sound quality is pretty good for such a small speaker, and I like the "smart" features it has. My one concern with it is that is goes offline frequently, and has to be unplugged and rebooted. I have three other Echo devices, and do not have this issue with any of those. Since this is my primary device for controlling other smart devices in my home, it's troubling to have to reboot it so often. I hope this does not forebode a future failing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: But ... will it understand me?
customer_reviews.text: If you’re concerned whether or not Alexa will understand your accent, y’all please refer to the video. I have really enjoyed this product. Every now and then, it needs unplugging and replugging, but not often. I work from home, and Alexa’s playing about half of an eight hour shift. I’ve had no major VPN issues due to Alexa working in the background. And just to avoid confusion, I am from Texas, but currently live in Michigan. Yes, that is a Michigan State University cap. I don’t care for sports. I chose the Spartans because I prefer WKAR to other NPR stations. Mary Ellen Pitney is my favorite morning host, and their classical music programming is phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality! Love the hand free ability! Lots of family dance parties in the kitchen with the kiddos!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love our girl ALexa!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is visually impaired and has been since 2000. Anything that can make his life easier is so worth it and now we have Alexa. She reads the news for him every morning she sets timers when he’s cooking. Well, you can imagine the things she can do for him because reading is such a problem. This is an amazing tool for both of us and the possibilities are endless. I would highly recommend an Echo for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: P. Goossens

customer_reviews.title: first time using this in my house
customer_reviews.text: install went easy. after about a week, I notice that it would no wake up when I speak to it, had to reboot. but this was hit and miss. I also notice sometimes there will be static in the background when speaking, again this is hit and miss. other wise its ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t connect with Spotify. Customer support won’t call back.
customer_reviews.text: When it works the sound is great. However, it doesn’t work very often. Sometimes it’ll play when I want to play and then it’ll just stop. Or sometimes the subwoofer will play but then the echo won’t. We have no clue why it does this because customer support won’t call us back. Even though they said they would. So, we are going to return it because this sucks.
customer_reviews.author: KnittedLauren

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth issue
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 Echo Dots in house. All of them work well. I boughth this one because reviews say its sound is better than Echo Dot. Actually, sound is slightly better but its bluetooth keeps disconnecting to my PC, or when bluetooth was connected there was nosaound. . I reset and reconnected more than 10 times but could not fix this issue. May be I got a lemon, Amazon offered a replacement but I returned and changed back to my Echo Dot. Echo Dot works perfectly and no issue at all.
customer_reviews.author: Electronic guy

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for Prime!!
customer_reviews.text: Not ready for prime time. Very very bogus, full of glitches... if you want to use as stereo pair or 2.1 with subwoofer stay away for now...
customer_reviews.author: felipe954

customer_reviews.title: I used to use this to listen to waves all night long. That ability was taken away.
customer_reviews.text: I used to use this to listen to waves all night long. That ability was taken away. These things are less and less useful all the time. They have turned into a complete waste of time and money. They used to work, no longer. I’m stuck using old technology. New technology, very often, does not function at all. I am moving and my whole house audio system can’t go. It works great, not sold any more, it’s hooked up to an “airport express”, also, not sold any more.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Lipschitz

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: These have been terrible for 1 major reason. Keep in mind I have 4 other echo products. I bought 2 of them so they could be paired to listen to music in stereo and they sound great....however they both loose connection from the internet on a regular basis. None of my other echo products do this so I know it's not my internet. All you have to do is unplug them and plug them back in but how obnoxious is that to do atleast once a week for both units.
customer_reviews.author: kurt wendel

customer_reviews.title: Great new device
customer_reviews.text: The newest iteration of the vanilla Echo has much better sound than the previous generation. I would say it's definitely more of an upgrade from 2nd to 3rd generation in terms of sound than there was between 1st and 2nd. I love the Twilight Blue color, but I do have one question: since the new Echo is the same size and form factor as the Echo Plus (2nd Gen), why not offer that device in the new color? Seems like it should be incredibly easy to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You’re missing out if you don’t have one!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Echo Plus! I use it for everything and mostly listening to music. I ask Alexa what the temperature is inside and I can look on my Alexa app to get the temperature inside when I’m not home. I use it to set alarms, reminders, listen to noise or storms to help me sleep... I have connected it my Echo Dot to listen to the same music in different rooms. I can call anyone on it and walk around from room to room, (within reason), and the person on the other end can still hear me speak. You will have to connect your Alexa app to call or text. I love it. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Boston

customer_reviews.title: HiFi Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I've been using our old gen 1 Alexa hockey puck for a few years and the integration is great. This new Echo Plus sounds wonderful. My family can easily pop on some music and doesn't notice the difference with our stereo. I will listen much of the time directly through this speaker or just tell it to turn on my stereo if I'm going to turn up the music. This Echo Plus also has direct integration with Smart Devices. I just ordered some z-wave switches but haven't installed them yet but don't expect any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ressinger

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly better sound than my first Echo.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be hard to improve the sound from my first Echo in such a compact unit, but they accomplished that in this Echo plus. I have used the built in hub yet, because I mainly use it for music when I'm cooking. But I'm sure I'll eventually venture into the Alexa controlled gadgets before long. I'm completely satisfied so far and I don't expect that to change. If you're even thinking about buying one, go ahead and do it, you won't regret it. Thank you guys and God bless.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this paper weight
customer_reviews.text: Alexa does not know very much you may as well just talk to Google on your phone. She can do nothing like I thought. She cannot play my music off of YouTube unless I link my phone to it. Any questions I have asked her if she may have known four of 10. Complete waste of money. I wish I had just bought a Bluetooth speaker
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Sub-par sound
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited when the For 3rd gen came out with a much better speaker than the 1st & 2ns gen so I thought this speaker would be great. Very, very disappointed with Amazon - a definite "miss" on this, just like the Echo Auto. Poor sound quality, sub-par voice recognition compared to my Dots. Optwd to return and spend the extra $$ for a Bose speaker w/Alexa. Definitely more expensive, but if I'm going to listen to music I want it to sound great.
customer_reviews.author: KMM

customer_reviews.title: Voice recognition is infuriating
customer_reviews.text: Alexa reminds me of every ex I ever had. It doesn't listen, it's expensive, it causes me to argue with it, and I can't wait to dump it. Alexa YELLS AT ME AT THE MAX VOLUME when watching or listening to something with lower audio quality. It's very unsettling, stop waking up my kids. Why can't I adjust Alexa's voice to never be at maximum volume?
customer_reviews.author: Sassafraz

customer_reviews.title: Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I have the echo 1, dot 3, and I love them. This past year I order echo 3 and have been surprised. My echo 1 out performs the Red echo 3. The echo 3 often doesn't understand me from the same location the echo 1 use to be positioned. I have to repeat the commands twice before being recognized. The sound of the echo 1 and dot 3 are also better. I am not sure if I just ended up with a sub par Red echo 3 or this is it, Surprise! I will continue to purchase the dot for the convenience in other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Looks great...but
customer_reviews.text: I have had an Echo since it came out, I do have a V1 and needed another for another room. I replace the V1 with a better looking V3 Echo and it looks great in the living room. But, maybe it is just a sentiment me, the V1 seems to respond better and the audio is clearer then the V3. I have to talk louder to the V3...and even then sometime I have to repeat. I am still using the V1 unit and often stream on both. I still have a 5 star rating on the V1, but feel the V3 is a bit of a disappointment. I will give it more time...
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: A solid little speaker
customer_reviews.text: Although I am an "Apple-guy" I have now 11 Alexa enabled devices (incl. the Fire TVs). Alexa still stumbles over a few voice commands, but on average she does a good job understanding what I want. To this specific speaker: The Pros: Solid build. OK sound quality. Small footprint. Looks decent. The "Multi Room" feature is great. Playing quietly in every room of the house is so much nicer than having to play it very loud in one of the rooms. The con's The sound of the individual speaker is just OK. The power input? Why not a USB C cord? All that being said: I stick to my 5 stars. I recommend this Echo 3rd gen.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I simply could not get this to work. I tried 4 of them and all of them dropped audio on Amazon music. It worked fine for spotify, but not for Amazon music. Also it would lock up when trying to get the speaker to respond. I currently have 7 other speakers from dots to studios that work well. Hopefully it works for you but I gave up at 4 tries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Voice recognition doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I don't really like to write a review, but lately I have been having so much trouble with Alexa to recognize when I called out her name... It doesn't matter if the speaker is playing music or not.. most of the time Alexa doesn't respond to my commands.. I am so Desappointed about that. I liked the idea of hands free playing music but it gets so annoyed having to yelled out super loud and not being heard. I literally have to go to the speaker and press a button for her to listen to me. I hate it...
customer_reviews.author: leydi

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a replacement for Wink Hub
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for the Wink Hub because they moved to a subscription based platform and I didn't wish to pay a monthly fee. The Echo Plus recognized my Zigbee GE Link Bulbs quickly after I put them in pairing mode. I was easily able to rename each of the 5 bulbs, group them and give them a routine. They respond quickly to verbal commands through the Echo Plus' built in Zigbee Hub. Note: Z-wave devices do not work with this device, so you need another option to control them. The bass sound is noticeably better than the original echo and it also has a built in thermometer so you can ask it your room's current temperature.
customer_reviews.author: musicman

customer_reviews.title: 2 stars because of a TERRIBLE App
customer_reviews.text: I have both a Google Home & Alexa. The sound quality is relatively the same, and while I can say the sound quality on Echo Plus is very good, the biggest reason I prefer Google Home over Echo Plus is because of the TERRIBLE Alexa app, which sounds odd I am sure. However, the user experience is so awful and it hasn't changed since Gen1 that I have to knock off 3 stars. If I had a choice between Alexa & Google Home today, I would choose Google home every time. I cannot for the life of me understand how Amazon could make such a fantastic speaker and backed with such a god awful application.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: continually repeats songs and ad 2-3
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great, but it will continually repeat ads and songs 2-3 times. Claimed not their issue but when isolated the music is just fine. Reconnect to Sonos and it starts again. Go online you will see numerous complaints regarding this. They finally said they were working on it, but no resolution yet. Everything else is great, but the repeating is very aggravating. I just heard the same song 3 times while rating this product. If they ever get this fixed I would give them 5 stars but until then very disappointed in a investment of nearly $2000.00 Have 5 Play1s, 2 subs and boost.
customer_reviews.author: donald hasty

customer_reviews.title: Won’t play music from my linked music
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this speaker when it comes to playing linked music. It does not play music linked from tidal or Apple Music. I hate that I can’t play my created playlist. It just really sucks to have a speaker with different capabilities and I can’t even play the music that I want.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Cooks

customer_reviews.title: Impressive operation but had a fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: I had my Echo for about two weeks before it quit working. Two days ago I tried to use it but it would not respond to my voice. When I picked the device up the bottom was VERY hot and the odor of burned wiring was very strong. I waited a few hours for it to cool down and plugged it back in. It would not energize so I called Amazon Tech Support. After answering a few quick questions it was determined that it had to be replaced at no cost to me. As of right now, I am waiting for the new one to be delivered.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Small responsive issues, I like my dots better.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 alexas in my house. This thing and 2 dots. My dots (3rd gen) are far more responsive. Yes, this has better sound by a little when it comes to music. But, sometimes I have to say alexa more than once to get it to respond. Then when it does respond, sometimes it misses the command. All these issues I don't have with my dots. Maybe the Echo 3rd generation doesnt have these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Adair

customer_reviews.title: Stubborn
customer_reviews.text: My Alexa has gotten dumb. She stopped listening and only does what I ask her when she feels like it. Sometimes I have to ask her several times. Its like she has developed a personality of a teenage girl and its been torture. She worked great at first when she replaced my echo dot. Now, I just wonder about her..
customer_reviews.author: Marie DiMaggio

customer_reviews.title: Terribly inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: Bought six Echo Dots, then upgraded all to Echo 2nd and 3rd generations. Wanted to play music throughout the house, seamlessly playing my playlists. What a disappointment! Alexa will play three or four songs, then quit. If I ask her to play a certain song, one minute she complies, an hour later claims she doesn't know the song she just played. Very, very frustrating. I've tried the usual and customary "fixes" to no avail. She does do a great job telling time and the weather forecast. A lot of money for time and forecasts. If anyone has any advice as to what I'm doing wrong, I would love to hear.
customer_reviews.author: clarabelle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Device - Excellent Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first device with artificial intelligence. So far, I have only played music, made a phone call, and asked for the weather, sports score, etc. It is amazing what it can do. I made a mistake during set up and gave it the wrong mobile phone number. I called customer service and they answered with a live person almost immediately. She walked me through the numerous steps to correct the problem and it worked. I couldn't be happier with the device and the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The device I never knew I needed
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased it for me because he knew I would love it, and he was right, I dont know how I lived without it for so long. Alexa plays my favorite music while I cook, read the daily bible text for me, tells me the news, the weather, and even jokes! It sound great and integrates well with all my devices and apps to make my life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn M. De León-Piña

customer_reviews.title: Way Above Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I've not found anything to dislike as of this writing. Set up was a breeze, using the Echo Plus is just plain simple. And as for the sound. WOW! This little device has really BIG sound! Whatever music you like, sit back, relax and enjoy the rich, clean delivery you'd expect from a much bigger device. How much do I like it? I just ordered another one for my office! This little giant will also help you turn your home into a smart home with a few accessories, a short learning curve, and very little effort. It really does perform way above expectations...
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Illinois

customer_reviews.title: A little too much bass but good sound overall
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth Echo device. I decided to try the bigger model to see if it would be an improvement over the already-good sound of the echo dot. It is. It has too much bass for my taste, even after reducing it to the minimum in the Alexa app. This is mostly a bother when she talks to me - a bit hard to understand. But overall, really good sound for casual music listening. The usual Alexa features work great. Naturally, the usual caveats apply, the same as with any device like this - watch what you say that she can hear, and be aware that hacking is possible with any communication device.
customer_reviews.author: Engineering Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: The 3rd generation Echo has been unavailable for some time now. Buying the Echo Plus second generation at nearly 1/2 original price was a great deal to get the improved sound quality. Be aware that because of the “plus” capability the original setup can add a little confusion. I walked through all the setup steps in the Alexa app, but it kept saying it was ‘calibrating’. It took a number of hours for the calibrating to finish, but in the meanwhile normal functions worked fine. I think the calibrating has to do with the built-in temperature sensor in this model. I do not use the zigbee hub features, so I cannot comment on those.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with Fire TV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this speaker to play audio from my Fire TV in another part of the house IN ADDITION to over my stereo speakers in the living room. When I went to set it up the Alexa app tells me my Fire TV stick is not compatible despite the website description. I was able to connect it through bluetooth but this turns off the audio locally and only routes it through the Echo speaker. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Williams

customer_reviews.title: Echo Plus (2nd Gen) Charcoal
customer_reviews.text: This speaker has outstanding sound quality, my wife loves the deep quality music, while on her long daily treadmill walks. I wasn’t successful at getting this one to accept our town location, so simply gave up after several attempts, with two different iPads. When I ask for the air quality it gives me a neighboring town 15 miles away, close enough I guess. The Sandstone one, installed at the same time, accepts our correct town and gives us the correct air quality. In summation, I think the Alexa App, for this device, needs improvement as I have installed several older Echos with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: John E. De Vous

customer_reviews.title: It was a gift to me
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift that I didn't expect. My family thought it would be great to have, and especially because I could call 911 if I ever needed help. Well, we tried that out, and guess what? It can't access 911. You have to call it on your phone. However, I sometimes listen to NPR and music on it, but haven't really explored anything other than Shopping List. I can also call out the name of someone on my list and Echo will call that person. A type of 911, I guess. Someday I'll explore it in more depth and get more use out of it, I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: Valentina S.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good Sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an upgrade for my first gen Echo and to eliminate the need for the Phillips Hue hub. As a hub goes, had no issues connecting all my smart home stuff to it. The big surprise was the sound quality. It's nearly as good as our top of the line Bose bluetooth speaker that cost $400. I'm tempted to buy a second one just to use the stereo music feature that Alexa apparently now has. Two of these pluse a Spotify account would be a nice little home stereo system.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Built My Hotrod

product_meta.title: Echo Plus (2nd Gen) - Premium sound with built-in smart home hub - Sandstone
feature_bullets: Meet the Echo Plus - Same great sound as our Echo (3rd Gen) with a built-in Zigbee hub to easily setup and control your compatible smart home devices.

Enjoy premium sound - Personalize your listening experience by adjusting the equalizer settings. Or pair with a second Echo Plus (2nd Gen) or Echo (3rd Gen) for stereo sound and add more bass with an Echo Sub.

Voice control your music - Ask Alexa for a song, artist, or genre from Amazon Music, Apple Music, Spotify, Pandora, SiriusXM, and more. With multi-room music, play music on compatible Echo devices in different rooms.
Voice control your smart home - Turn on lights, adjust thermostats, lock doors, and more with compatible connected devices. Create routines to start and end your day.
Keep your family in sync - Use your Alexa devices like an intercom and talk to any room in the house with Drop In and Announcements.
Alexa has skills - With tens of thousands of skills and counting, Alexa is always getting smarter and adding new skills like tracking fitness, playing games, and more.
Designed to protect your privacy - Built with multiple layers of privacy controls, including a microphone off button that electronically disconnects the mics.
